edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class UpdateSensors

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.UpdateSensors
public class UpdateSensors
extends java.lang.Object

An UpdateSensors class provides the ability to update the sensor values of the robot based on the robot's environment, and its position/orientation in that environment.

public UpdateSensors(int[][] map,
                     CurrentRobotState rState,
                     javax.swing.JLabel[] sLabels,
                     WorldPanel world)
Allocate a new UpdateSensors object.

Parameters:
map - 500x500 object id matrix - see WorldrawManager.java for details
rState - robot state information
sLabels - sensor readings labels - see KSFrame.java for details
world - reference to main panel
Method Detail

reInitialize

protected void reInitialize()
Reset this object back to the default values.

getDisplayMode

protected java.lang.String getDisplayMode()
Get the sensor display mode (distance, light, or none) for sensor label updates on the GUI.

Returns:
"distance", "light", or "disable"

setDisplayMode

protected void setDisplayMode(java.lang.String mode)
Set the sensor display mode (distance, light, or disable) for sensor label updates on the GUI.

Parameters:
mode - "distance", "light", or "disable"

setDistParam

protected void setDistParam(int dp)
Set the distance sensing parameter. This value is used to tweak sensor sensitivity from the GUI controls.

Parameters:
dp - new distance sensing parameter

setLightParam

protected void setLightParam(int lp)
Set the light sensing parameter. This value is used to tweak sensor sensitivity from the GUI controls.

Parameters:
lp - new light sensing parameter

getStuckObjects

protected java.util.Vector getStuckObjects()
Returns a reference to the current stuckObject vector. stuckObjects is a collection of ball/cap objects that are currently "stuck" against some static object in the current world configuration, hence they cannot move unless grabbed by the gripper.

Returns:
(see above)

processSensors

protected void processSensors()
Indirectly computes the light and distance readings for all sensors based on the robot's current state, coordinates and orientation.
